summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/03/10
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jamie Payne', 'James Kent', 'Colin Teague'], 'Producers': ['John Griffin', 'Colin Callender', 'George Faber', 'Charles Pattinson', 'Philippa Gregory', 'Eurydice Gysel', 'Jan Vrints'], 'Starring': ['Rebecca Ferguson', 'James Frain', 'Amanda Hale'], 'Studio': ['Starz']}
Review Text: This is my third time through this series. OK, so it features a zipper or two in the opener (boy, did costumes fix That fast!) and only the old women wear headpieces (perhaps with all the headpieces and hats we wouldn't know which actor is which?). These are problems of a 21st century production for a 21st century audience of a story over 500 years old, and What a Story It Is! These actors bring depth, complexity and humanity to characters that may have, up to now, only appeared in a chapel's stained glass windows or the face of a playing card. The producers also seemed to care that the actors resembled the characters to the extent that we know. Having read the three books the season's based upon may have given me an edge, but the dialogue keeps the viewer well informed as to who is who. Sets and costumes are outstanding (except for a few minor historical glitches). And King Edward's horse -- don't get me started on The Horse! What a scene stealer he is, and I think he knows it!
Review Title: Just sit back and enjoy the show!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/06/09
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Diane Crespo'], 'Producers': ['Molly Pearson', 'Paul Marcarelli', 'Ward Sparacio'], 'Starring': ['Natasha Lyonne', 'Joshua Leonard', 'Carol Kane'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']}
Review Text: Presents an honest and realistic picture of what our collective obsession with things is creating in our culture, our children and our selves. Poignant, dramatic, funny and full of insight -- we all know someone with too much stuff, so all of us should see it.
Review Title: funny and full of insight -- we all know someone ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/06/17
Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Marc Forster'], 'Producers': ['Deborah Schoeneman', 'Mark Hudis', 'Becky Hartman Edwards', 'Jillian Kugler', 'Jeff King', 'Ron Perlman', 'Brian Wilkins', 'Marc Forster', 'Ben Watkins'], 'Starring': ['Ron Perlman', 'Dana Delany', 'Andre Royo'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Review Text: Engaging plot with three-dimensional character brought to life by incredible performances -- I want more!
Review Title: More, more, more!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/05/16
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Byfield', 'Alex Berwick', 'Sarah Lawrence'], 'Producers': ['Sally Woodward Gentle'], 'Starring': ['Rupert Penry-Jones', 'Phil Davis', 'Steve Pemberton'], 'Studio': ['BBC Studios']}
Review Text: I love Rupert Penry-Jones' OCD DI Chandler, and his relationship with his DS Miles. There's humor and heart in these characters as the Brits do so well, as well as the story-lines that .... OK, I'm a woos ... I could only watch while the sun was shining, they're that creepy good! You've been warned!
Review Title: Amazon -- please post the last season, or I'll have to go to order a non-regional DVD player and pay for the last season myself!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual exhibits a strong preference for engaging narratives that blend humor, drama, and character depth, consistently delivering high ratings (average 4.5+). Their positive sentiments highlight an appreciation for well-acted performances and rich storytelling, particularly in historical and character-driven series.  

Common themes in the data indicate a fondness for complex character dynamics and plots that evoke emotional connections. They also seem drawn to productions with cultural critiques, recognizing societal obsessions and flaws. Quality matters, as their lower ratings correlate with less impactful storytelling, yet they still exhibit an inclination to seek out thought-provoking content. 

In terms of quality preferences, they seem to favor content that includes substantial production values (sets, costumes, performances). Price sensitivity does not emerge clearly from the data but is implied through a willingness to engage deeply with content despite some dissatisfaction in certain ratings. 

Overall, their core preferences suggest a predilection for well-crafted, insightful entertainment, revealing a demand for both profound themes and entertaining escapism in their viewing choices.

target_interaction.title: Appreciate modern times by learning about lives in the past
target_interaction.text: These videos make me appreciate my life now despite Hollywood's glamorization of the era. Back then I wouldn't have made it past age 4; Yay for science and penicillin!
